347.article_body: Remembering 2017 Women's World Cup final on its fifth anniversary, Mithali Raj, who led India to the final against England, tweeted, "This day at Lord's in 2017 didn't favour us but I believe it helped turn a page in Indian women's cricket." She added, "It changed the perspective towards women's cricket in India." England defeated India by nine runs.

348.title: When he bats, it seems he's million-dollar: Aakash on Gill's 64 vs WI
348.article_body: Praising Shubman Gill following his 53-ball 64 in India's three-run win against West Indies in first ODI, Aakash Chopra said the India opener batted "extremely well". He added, "The way he started with the drive, after that the punch...he's brilliant. When he bats, it seems he is million-dollar." Gill hit six fours and two sixes during his maiden ODI half-century.

349.title: North Korea warns US, South Korea against military exercises
349.article_body: North Korea has warned the United States and South Korea against conducting joint military drills, saying these exercises were pushing the Korean Peninsula to war. Choe Jin, a senior official in Pyongyang, accused the two countries of planning to deploy US nuclear assets in their future drills. The comments come as Washington and Seoul prepare for upcoming military drills.

350.title: 500 condoms, 400 liquor bottles found in brothel allegedly run by BJP leader in Meghalaya
350.article_body: Six children were rescued and 73 people arrested from a "brothel" allegedly run by BJP's Meghalaya Vice-President Bernard N Marak in Tura on Saturday, said police. Rimpu Bagan, a farmhouse owned by Marak, was raided on the basis of a tip-off. In the raid, 27 vehicles, eight two-wheelers, about 400 bottles of liquor and over 500 unused condoms were seized.

351.title: I was scared of hosting 'Khatron...' due to superstars: Rohit Shetty
351.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty has said that he was initially scared of hosting reality show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi' because of the participation of "actors and superstars". He further said that he knew it was the right choice to host it when he heard the TRPs. "My manager came running saying...it's the highest-rated show. I could not believe it," the filmmaker added.

352.title: Preparing to export grain from ports despite Russian attack: Ukraine
352.article_body: Ukrainian Infrastructure Minister Oleksandr Kubrakov said Ukraine continues to prepare to restart grain exports from its Black Sea ports despite a Russian missile strike that hit Odesa port on Saturday. Notably, Russia attacked Odesa less than 24 hours after signing a UN-backed agreement with Ukraine aimed at restarting the grain exports. Russia had blocked the Ukrainian ports amid the war.

353.title: Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee hospitalised hours after arrest
353.article_body: West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in a teacher recruitment scam, was admitted to the Intensive Coronary Care Unit (ICCU) of SSKM Hospital after he complained of uneasiness, an official of ED said. According to a hospital official, several tests, including electrocardiogram, were conducted. "He is stable at the moment," the official added.

354.title: Tamil Nadu govt sends more relief material to crisis-hit Sri Lanka
354.article_body:
The Tamil Nadu government on Saturday dispatched another round of essential items to Sri Lanka 
amid an economic crisis in the country. DMK MP Kanimozhi tweeted and said she flagged off the consignment from the VOC Port in Thoothukudi in the presence of state ministers. The relief material included rice, medicines and other essential commodities, valued around ₹74 crore.

355.title: I had promised my father I won't ever lose my dignity: Rupali Ganguly on casting couch
355.article_body: 'Anupamaa' actress Rupali Ganguly spoke to ETimes and shared that casting couch existed in 90s and hence she stepped out of the film industry. "I had a film background but I had promised my father...I won't ever lose my dignity," she said. "I couldn't handle how the industry worked then, especially...casting couch...I decided I can't deal with it," Rupali added.

356.title: Be in no doubt, I'm the underdog: Rishi Sunak on race to be next UK PM
356.article_body: Speaking about the race to become the next UK PM, ex-British Finance Minister Rishi Sunak said, "Be in no doubt, I am the underdog." "The forces that be want this to be a coronation for the other candidate, but I think members want a choice," he added. Foreign Secretary Liz Truss is the second candidate in the race.

357.title: 10 dead, 7 injured as mountain collapses at coal mine in China
357.article_body: Ten people were killed and seven were injured on Saturday after a section of a mountain collapsed at a coal mine in China's Gansu province, Chinese state media outlet CCTV reported. The report said that the landslide occurred while employees were moving around the mining site. An investigation is now reportedly underway to determine the cause of the accident.

358.title: Sri Lankan Cabinet expected to be expanded: Lankan minister
358.article_body: Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe is expected to expand his Cabinet to include all Opposition parties in it, Tourism Minister Harin Fernando said. Wickremesinghe on Friday formed an 18-member Cabinet after the previous government was dissolved following months-long public protests. The newly named Cabinet has 16 members from the same party, Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna.

359.title: 28 kg whale vomit worth ₹28 crore found by fishermen in Kerala
359.article_body: A group of fishermen from Vizhinjam in Thiruvananthapuram found 28.4 kg of ambergris or 'whale vomit' worth ₹28 crore in the sea and handed it over to the Kerala Coastal Police. The ambergris was later collected by Kerala Forest Department. Ambergris, which is produced in the digestive system of sperm whales, is used to manufacture perfumes.

360.title: Alia gave 'Gangubai...', she can demand what she wants: Arjun on pay parity
360.article_body: Speaking about the lack of pay parity in the film industry, actor Arjun Kapoor said that actress Alia Bhatt has delivered 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' following which she can demand what she wants. "You earn your right...It's not even about parity...You should be paid your worth. You have to prove your worth and then you should be paid," the actor added.

361.title: Pak PM's son Hamza Sharif takes oath as Punjab CM after re-election
361.article_body: Hamza Sharif, the son of Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif, on Saturday took oath as the CM of Punjab province after being re-elected to the post following a run-off election. Sharif won by three votes after Deputy Speaker Dost Muhammad Mazari rejected 10 votes of his rival candidate Chaudhry Pervaiz Elahi's party. Elahi has approached the Supreme Court over Mazari's decision.

362.title: Complaint lodged against singer Sravana Bhargavi over music video
362.article_body: A complaint was lodged against Telugu singer Sravana Bhargavi in Tirupati on Saturday over her music video 'Okapari Kokapari'. The song was composed by Annamayya and his followers protested claiming she made the video in an indecent way. Sravana reacted to the protests, saying, "The video has no obscenity...When female singers release a video...some people raise objections and create controversy."

363.title: PFI is like RSS, why do you call them anti-nationals?: RJD leader
363.article_body: In an interview with ANI, Bihar's RJD chief Jagadanand Singh said Islamic terrorist outfit Popular Front of India (PFI) is like Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS). He added, "They (PFI) also want to serve their community...Why do you call them anti-nationals?" He alleged, "Whenever...security forces [arrested people] as Pakistani agents, all of them were related to RSS and Hindu community."

364.title: 40 students fall sick after eating midday meals at school in K'taka
364.article_body: At least 40 students of Government Higher Primary School in Karnataka's Chitradurga district fell sick after eating the midday meal served at the school on Thursday afternoon. Of the 40 students, 26 of them were hospitalised. The food samples have been sent to a laboratory to ascertain if it was a case of food poisoning, school headmaster Doddappa MC said.

365.title: Gem stones worth ₹94 lakh seized in Chennai, Sri Lankan national held
365.article_body:
Over 1,700 pieces of assorted gem stones worth ₹94.34 lakh were seized at Chennai airport and a Sri Lankan national was arrested in this connection, the customs department said on Saturday. 
Initial examinations revealed that the passenger who arrived from Colombo had swallowed packets containing the precious stones. The officials recovered 56 packets containing gem stones from him.

366.title: Crocodiles enter residential areas in Guj amid rainfall, pics emerge
366.article_body: Crocodiles entered residential areas in Gujarat's Vadodara due to heavy rainfall in the area. Residents living near the bank of Vishwamitri River complained about crocodiles entering their homes, Hindustan Times reported. As per ABP's report, teams deployed by Forest Department have captured 27 crocodiles and have released them in the river. Vishwamitri River is home to more than 250 crocodiles.

367.title: McLaughlin wins 400m hurdles in 50.68s, becomes 1st woman to run under 51s
367.article_body: American Sydney McLaughlin broke her own world record to win a gold medal in 400 metres hurdles at World Championships after finishing the race in 50.68 seconds on Saturday in Oregon. She slashed 0.73 off her previous mark of 51.41 set at Hayward Field last month and became the first woman to run under 51 seconds in the event.

368.title: 3 of a family shot dead while camping in US, suspect kills self
368.article_body: Three members of a family were shot dead during their camping trip to a state park in the US state of Iowa on Friday, police said. The suspected shooter was later found dead with a self-inflicted gunshot wound in the park itself, an official added. He said it could not be ascertained if the suspect had a prior criminal record.

369.title: Cow-calf born with 2 heads due to rare genetic defect in Brazil, pic surfaces
369.article_body: Pictures of a two-headed cow baby born on a farm in Brazil have surfaced online. The calf was born with a serious and very rare genetic defect on July 18 and lived for almost four full days before succumbing to it on July 21. Cattle breeder Elidan said the calf died before it could be taken to a veterinarian.

370.title: Odisha school teacher suspended for molesting 15-yr-old girl student
370.article_body: A teacher of a government-run high school in Odisha's Kendrapara district was suspended on Saturday for allegedly molesting a 15-year-old girl student, officials said. The teenager's father, who filed a complaint, claimed that the girl was molested in the school premises. A case has been registered against the teacher under IPC section 354 (outraging modesty) and POCSO Act.

371.title: 1,000 artefacts missing from Sri Lankan Prez, PM's homes: Police
371.article_body: Over 1,000 valuable artefacts from Sri Lanka's Presidential Palace and Prime Minister's official residence are missing after protesters occupied these premises earlier this month, police said on Saturday. Notably, the Department of Archaeology does not have a detailed record of artefacts at Presidential Palace, a local report said. Special investigation teams have been formed to probe the matter.

372.title: Lufthansa is terrible with handling connecting passengers: Rahul Vaidya
372.article_body: Singer Rahul Vaidya made a series of posts on Instagram Stories criticising Lufthansa Airlines. He wrote, "@lufthansa you are terrible with handling connecting passengers!" In another post, the singer wrote, "After @lufthansa making life hell for us back to our best desi carrier @vistara." Rahul returned to Mumbai with his wife on Saturday after celebrating their first anniversary in London.

373.title: Shinzo Abe's suspected killer to undergo psychiatric evaluation
373.article_body: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's suspected assassin will go through psychiatric evaluation till later this year, local media said on Saturday. A court in Nara Prefecture, where the assassination occurred, agreed to the request for a psychiatric examination. The evaluation will ascertain whether the suspect will be indicted for the shooting.

374.title: How does WHO declare an outbreak a public health emergency?
374.article_body: WHO chief Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said he's required to consider five elements for declaring an outbreak a global health emergency, as has been done with monkeypox. The information given by nations, the three International Health Regulations criteria and the Emergency Committee's advice are among them. Scientific principles and evidence and finally risk to human health are also considered.

375.title: Sanctions on Russia failed, EU needs new strategy: Hungarian PM
375.article_body: Hungarian PM Viktor Orban on Saturday said the EU needs a new strategy for the war in Ukraine as sanctions against Russia have proven ineffective. He said that the strategy should focus on drafting a "good peace proposal" instead of winning the war. Only talks between Russia and the US can establish peace as Moscow wants "security guarantees", he added.

376.title: Man killed, 2 others injured after truck-motorcycle collision in UP
376.article_body: A 22-year-old man was killed on the spot and two others were seriously injured after their motorcycle collided with a speeding truck in the Kokhraj area of UP's Kaushambi district on Saturday, police said. The accident happened when the motorcycle rider tried to negotiate a turn, Kokhraj SHO said. The driver of the truck is absconding, he further informed.

377.title: 22-year-old man found with throat slit inside his home in Agra
377.article_body: A 22-year-old man named Ghanshyam was allegedly killed with his throat slit at his house in Prakash Nagar area of Agra, Uttar Pradesh, police said. Ghanshyam's neighbours found him in a pool of blood on Saturday morning. Ghanshyam lived with his mother. However, he was alone when the incident took place as his mother had gone to a relative's house.

378.title: China, Pakistan agree to welcome an interested 3rd country in CPEC
378.article_body: China and Pakistan have agreed to include "interested" countries in the $60 billion China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC), describing it as "an open and inclusive platform" for cooperation. The CPEC is a corridor linking Pakistan's Gwadar Port on the Arabian Sea with Kashgar in China's Xinjiang province. India has protested the CPEC as it passes through Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

379.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states till July 27, list released
379.article_body: In its latest bulletin, the IMD issued heavy to very rainfall warning for several states till July 27. It is very likely in Telangana till July 27. It's also very likely over Chhattisgarh and MP till July 26. Heavy rainfall is very likely over Odisha on July 24 & 25. It's likely over West Bengal and Sikkim on July 27.

380.title: 63 lakh Sri Lankans are facing food insecurity: UN agency
380.article_body: UN's World Food Programme (WFP) on Saturday said that around 63 lakh Sri Lankans are facing food insecurity amid the severe economic crisis in the country, ANI reported. The UN agency further said that it has been able to raise only 30% of the $63 million it needs to provide emergency food supplies to 30 lakh people till December 2022.

381.title: Matter of time before Kohli gets back in form: Anjum Chopra
381.article_body: Amid Virat Kohli's poor form, ex-India Women captain Anjum Chopra said she's sure the India batter is doing everything to regain his form. "A player like him must be trying and trying to get out of the slump...I'm sure that it will be a matter of time that he will be back among runs for the Indian team," she added.

382.title: Sushmita represents empowered Indian woman: Pooja on 'gold digger' comments
382.article_body: Actress Pooja Bedi spoke in support of Sushmita Sen after the latter was called a "gold digger" over her relationship with Lalit Modi. She said, "She represents the emancipated, empowered Indian woman that we should all admire." Pooja further said that Sushmita has set the stage for a progressive change as we emerge from a patriarchal, sexist and ageist era.

383.title: Union Home Ministry transfers probe in Bihar PFI case to NIA
383.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) transferred the probe into the Popular Front Of India (PFI) "terror module" case to the NIA on Friday. Earlier this month, two individuals with links to the PFI were arrested from Bihar's capital Patna for their alleged involvement in "anti-India" activities. A third individual was later arrested from Lucknow in connection with the case.

384.title: I got confidence of death bowling from Rajasthan Royals: Chahal
384.article_body: Crediting Rajasthan Royals for giving him confidence of bowling in the death overs, India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said his IPL team gave him a role which helped him to bowl two-three overs after the 40-over mark in ODIs. Chasing 309, West Indies managed 305/6 in 50 overs in the first ODI. Chahal dismissed batter Brandon King(54) in the 45th over.

385.title: 6 students hospitalised after lightning strike near J'khand school
385.article_body: Six students were hospitalised following a lightning strike near the premises of a government school in the Bokaro district of Jharkhand on Saturday, as per authorities. Out of the 50 students who complained of complications after the incident, six were found to be mildly serious and were hospitalised, an official said. Two of those six students lost consciousness, he added.

386.title: Having women's cricket in multi-nation event can be game changer: Harmanpreet
386.article_body: Ahead of Commonwealth Games 2022, India Women limited-overs captain Harmanpreet Kaur said that having women's cricket in the multi-nation event can be a game changer. Notably, women's cricket is making its debut at Commonwealth Games. "This tournament is very important for us and this time we are playing for a medal," she added. The Games will begin on July 28.

387.title: Assam govt approves 2nd wildlife sanctuary in Barak Valley
387.article_body: The Assam government has approved the setting up of a second wildlife sanctuary in the state's Barak Valley, which is home to a multitude of birds and mammals. The Barak Bhuban Wildlife Sanctuary will be spread over an area of 320 sq km between the Barak river and the Sonai river. The valley is already home to Borail Wildlife Sanctuary.

388.title: There was blood coming out of his eyes: Aasif on 'Bhabi Ji...' actor Deepesh's death
388.article_body: Actor Aasif Sheikh, speaking about 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actor Deepesh Bhan's death, said, "There was blood coming out of his eyes, it's a clear sign of brain haemorrhage." "He must have not eaten anything in...morning, while playing cricket...his blood pressure must have increased...He immediately fell down," Aasif added. "After 40, you should...not exert yourself too much," he stated.

389.title: English cricketer Northeast smashes 410* in a first-class innings, sets multiple records
389.article_body: English batter Sam Northeast, while playing for Glamorgan against Leicestershire in County Championship, slammed 410*(450) in his team's first innings. He's the ninth batter in first-class cricket to score 400 runs in an innings and the first since Brian Lara in 2004. He became the first-ever Glamorgan cricketer to cross 400. Northeast's 410* is the third-highest score in county history.

390.title: PM posts pics of sky beam light Digital Jyot in Delhi for tributes to freedom fighters
390.article_body: PM Narendra Modi posted pictures of a sky beam light named 'Digital Jyot' that has been installed in Delhi's Central Park and urged people to pay tributes to freedom fighters. People can pay their tributes via digitaltribute.in and the same will be displayed, along with their names and pictures, at the LED screen in front of the 'Digital Jyot'.

391.title: Relative accuses woman of practising witchcraft, kills her in Ranchi
391.article_body: A 31-year-old woman named Seema Devi was beaten to death by her 35-year-old relative on Saturday in Ranchi, Jharkhand, police said. The accused, Baso Devi, had allegedly hit Seema with an iron rod. Police said she alleged that Seema practised witchcraft due to which some villagers had died. However, police suspect that the case is linked to a property dispute.

392.title: Monkeypox declared a global health emergency by WHO
392.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has declared monkeypox as a global health emergency. Around 65 countries have reported outbreaks of the viral disease as confirmed cases near 16,000. Monkeypox virus is transmitted from one person to another by close contact with lesions, body fluids, respiratory droplets and contaminated materials such as bedding, according to the WHO.

393.title: In difficult times, India's efforts were praised globally: Outgoing Prez
393.article_body: In his farewell speech in the Parliament on Saturday, President Ram Nath Kovind said, "World is struggling because of...pandemic. I hope we learn lessons from the pandemic, we forgot that we're all part of nature." "In difficult times, India's efforts were praised all across the world," he added. PM Narendra Modi and Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu attended the ceremony.

394.title: 4 persons trapped in flash flood rescued in J&K's Udhampur
394.article_body: Four persons trapped in a flash flood in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district were rescued in a joint operation by police and SDRF, officials said on Saturday. Four persons identified as Sanjeev Kumar, Mulkh Raj, Ajay Kumar and Sushil Kumar were rescued from the flash flood in the Barmeen nallah after locals informed the police post in Roundomail, they said.

395.title: Will act after verdict is out: TMC as ED arrests Bengal minister Partha
395.article_body: Following West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's arrest by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in an alleged teacher recruitment scam, TMC leader Firhad Hakim said the party will act "after the judiciary comes out with its verdict". "We're watching the situation and have faith in the judiciary. TMC will not tolerate any discrepancy or malpractice in party or in government," he added.

396.title: People's money being sacrificed for corruption in Bengal: Scindia
396.article_body: After West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee was arrested by Enforcement Directorate (ED), Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said his arrest is evidence of the fact that how people's money is being sacrificed for corruption in Bengal. "People will get to completely know about it, I'm confident," Scindia said. Partha Chatterjee was arrested in connection with an alleged teacher recruitment scam.

397.title: Parliament is a temple of democracy: Outgoing President Kovind
397.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind, in his farewell address to parliamentarians, termed Parliament a "temple of democracy". "As in any family, sometimes there are differences of opinion even in Parliament," he said. "But we're all members of the 'Parliament family' whose top priority is to continue working in the interest of the big joint family of the nation," President Kovind added.

398.title: Holiday declared in Telangana's Medak after heavy rains kill 3
398.article_body: At least three persons were killed due to heavy rains in Telangana's Medak after which District Collector S Harish announced a holiday as several places were cut off due to overflowing water. Police said two migrant workers from Bihar died after a wall collapsed in Reddypally village on Saturday. Another person drowned in floodwater in Vallabhapur, police added.

399.title: MPs should always follow Gandhian philosophy: Prez in farewell speech
399.article_body: During his farewell address on Saturday, President Ram Nath Kovind said, "MPs should always follow the Gandhian philosophy while exercising rights of debate and dissent in Parliament." "Mahatma Gandhi used peace and non-violence to instil harmony...we must adopt his ways," he added. The President further urged political parties to "rise above partisan politics" in national interest.

400.title: Maoist arrested in Jharkhand's Latehar, arms & ammunition seized
400.article_body: Police on Saturday said that 28-year-old Adesh Ganjhu alias Mangra, a member of the banned Tritiya Sammelan Prastuti Committee, was arrested in Jharkhand's Latehar district in an anti-Maoist operation. "A huge cache of arms and ammunition was recovered during the operation. This is for the first time that ultra-modern 40 mm HE grenades have been seized," Latehar SP said.

401.title: Shot putter Tajinder Toor excluded from CWG 2022 due to injury: AFI
401.article_body: Shot putter Tajinder Toor has been excluded from the Commonwealth Games 2022 squad due to an injury, stated Athletics Federation of India (AFI) on Saturday. Toor had sustained a groin injury in Chula Vista in USA where the Indian team had a brief training stint before ongoing World Championships. The 27-year-old didn't participate in the tournament in Oregon.
